title: Update Go version and Docker base images
description: The Dockerfile builder stage uses golang:1.24.1-alpine, but Go 1.25 is the current stable release (1.25.6 available). Update the Go version in the Dockerfile, go.mod, and any other references. Also review and update the Alpine base image to the latest stable. Go 1.26 is expected in February 2026 but is not yet released - use 1.25.x as the target for now.
acceptance_criteria: Dockerfile builder stage updated from golang:1.24.1-alpine to golang:1.25-alpine (or latest 1.25.x)
Alpine runtime image updated to latest stable if a newer version is available
Application builds successfully with make build
No deprecation warnings from the newer Go version
Any new go vet findings from the updated version are addressed

current_versions.go_mod: check go.mod for go directive version

approach: 1. Check current go.mod go directive version
2. Update Dockerfile builder FROM golang:1.24.1-alpine to golang:1.25-alpine
4. Run go mod tidy to update go.sum
6. Check for and fix any new warnings or deprecations
technical_notes.note: Go 1.26 is expected Feb 2026. If it releases during this sprint and is stable, consider targeting 1.26 instead.

testing_requirements: Application starts and serves all routes
No new compilation warnings or errors
Docker image size is similar or smaller

context.user_story: As a developer, I want the project to use a current and supported Go version so we get the latest security patches, performance improvements, and language features
